ground_truth: Finally, Stella blurts out as Lisa turns away from the window, and Stella also turns, interrupting her. Jeff, who is still staring out the window, has a look of sudden discovery on his face and calls quickly, turning halfway around and pointing. We see Lisa moving behind him toward the shelf as he adds, then he turns back to the window, holding out his right hand to the side, waiting for the box and viewer. The camera pulls back a little as Lisa comes up and places the box and viewer in his hand. Jeff opens the box, which contains color slides, and holds one or two of the slides up to the light as Lisa looks down at him curiously and Stella comes forward from the background. He squints out through the viewer, then looks away a moment without it before looking back through the viewer. Jeff takes the viewer from his eye, hands it to Lisa, who raises it to her eye. Through the viewer, we see the identical view out of the window, then the viewer moves away, and we are left with the same scene but not quite so still, as a slight breeze stirs the foliage. Jeff looks up to a puzzled Lisa, and all three ease back in awe as Lisa, still looking out, says something. Suddenly Stella begins to chuckle, but her face sobers as she answers their unasked question while Jeff looks at Stella. Halfway through Lisa's speech, Jeff begins speaking, and Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's, hiding and pressing back against the wall tensely. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns frustrated and comes out onto the fire escape directly above Lisa, who is aware of him and immediately retreats into the doorway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his fire escape. There is a sigh of relief from both of them, and Jeff hands something to her as Stella's brow knits a little, seeing something, and she reaches for the long-focus lens. She lifts it to her eye and opens a small brown bottle, taking out four red capsules which she places on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, where a candle burns in a holder, and other lamps also light the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is dressed in sedate street clothes and seems quite at peace as she sits at the table, and by the light of the candle, proceeds to open a black-covered book and read it. The print is fine, and she bends over it a moment, looks up at the capsules, and returns to the book while Stella and Jeff are heard over. She comes down the stairs as Lisa comes up to the two of them.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Finally, Stella blurts out as Lisa turns away from the aperture, and Stella also rotates, interrupting her. Jeff, who is still gazing out the aperture, has a look of sudden revelation on his visage and calls swiftly, turning halfway around and indicating. We see Lisa moving behind him toward the ledge as he adds, then he rotates back to the aperture, holding out his right hand to the side, awaiting the container and viewer. The camera withdraws a little as Lisa comes up and places the container and viewer in his hand. Jeff opens the container, which contains color transparencies, and holds one or two of the transparencies up to the illumination as Lisa looks down at him curiously and Stella comes forward from the backdrop. He squints out through the viewer, then looks away a moment without it before looking back through the viewer. Jeff takes the viewer from his eye, hands it to Lisa, who raises it to her eye. Through the viewer, we see the identical sight out of the aperture, then the viewer moves away, and we are left with the same scene but not quite so still, as a slight zephyr stirs the vegetation. Jeff looks up to a perplexed Lisa, and all three ease back in wonder as Lisa, still looking out, says something. Suddenly Stella begins to chuckle, but her face sobers as she answers their unasked query while Jeff looks at Stella. Halfway through Lisa's speech, Jeff begins speaking, and Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor entrance below Thorwald's, concealing and pressing back against the partition tensely. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns frustrated and emerges onto the fire escape directly above Lisa, who is aware of him and immediately retreats into the entryway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his fire escape. There is a sigh of relief from both of them, and Jeff hands something to her as Stella's brow furrows a little, noticing something, and she reaches for the long-focus lens. She raises it to her eye and opens a small brown bottle, extracting four red capsules which she places on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, where a candle burns in a holder, and other lamps also illuminate the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is attired in calm street clothes and seems quite at peace as she sits at the table, and by the glow of the candle, proceeds to open a black-covered tome and peruse it. The print is fine, and she bends over it a moment, looks up at the capsules, and returns to the tome while Stella and Jeff are heard above. She descends the stairs as Lisa ascends to the two of them.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: Finally, as Lisa turns away from the window, something is blurted out by Stella, and she is interrupted by Stella also turning. A look of sudden discovery is seen on Jeff's face, who is still staring out the window, and he quickly calls, halfway turning around and pointing. Lisa is seen moving behind him toward the shelf as an addition is made by him, then the window is turned back to by him, with his right hand held out to the side, waiting for the box and viewer. A little is pulled back by the camera as the box and viewer are placed in his hand by Lisa as she comes up. The box is opened by Jeff, containing color slides, and one or two of the slides are held up to the light by him as Lisa looks down at him curiously and Stella comes forward from the background. The viewer is squinted out through by him, then it is looked away from a moment without it before it's looked back through the viewer. The viewer is taken from his eye by Jeff, and it is handed to Lisa, who raises it to her eye. Through the viewer, the identical view out of the window is seen by us, then the viewer moves away, and the same scene is left with us but not quite so still, as a slight breeze stirs the foliage. A puzzled Lisa is looked up to by Jeff, and as Lisa, still looking out, says something, all three ease back in awe. Chuckling is suddenly begun by Stella, but her face sobers as an unasked question is answered by her while Stella is looked at by Jeff. Halfway through Lisa's speech, speaking is begun by Jeff, and at the ground floor door below Thorwald's, Lisa suddenly appears, hiding and pressing back against the wall tensely. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns frustrated and directly comes out onto the fire escape above Lisa, who is aware of him and immediately retreats into the doorway, disappearing down the lower corridor as his fire escape is searched by Thorwald. A sigh of relief is experienced by both of them, and something is handed to her by Jeff as a little is knitted by Stella's brow, seeing something, and the long-focus lens is reached for by her. It is lifted to her eye by her, and a small brown bottle is opened, taking out four red capsules which are placed on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, where a candle is burning in a holder, and other lamps also light the apartment. Sedate street clothes are worn by Miss Lonely Hearts, and quite at peace she seems, as the table is sat at by her, and by the candlelight, a black-covered book is opened and read by her. The print is fine, and over it, she bends a moment, the capsules are looked up at by her, and the book is returned to by her while Stella and Jeff are heard over. Down the stairs she comes, as the two of them are approached by Lisa.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Finally, Stella interrupts as Lisa turns from the window, and Jeff, still gazing outside, suddenly points with a look of discovery. Lisa moves toward the shelf as Jeff turns back, extending his hand for the box and viewer. The camera pulls back as Lisa places them in his hand. Jeff opens the box of color slides, holding a few to the light while Lisa watches curiously and Stella approaches. He squints through the viewer, then hands it to Lisa, who sees the same window view. The viewer moves away, revealing a slightly breezy scene. Jeff looks at a puzzled Lisa, and all three are in awe as Lisa speaks. Stella chuckles but then sobers, answering their unasked question. Midway through Lisa's speech, Jeff speaks, and Lisa appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's, hiding tensely. Thorwald, frustrated, comes onto the fire escape above Lisa, who retreats into the doorway, disappearing as he searches. Both sigh in relief, and Jeff hands something to her as Stella notices something, reaching for the long-focus lens. She lifts it to her eye, opens a small brown bottle, and places four red capsules on Miss Lonely Hearts' table, where a candle burns. Miss Lonely Hearts, in street clothes, sits peacefully, reading a black-covered book by candlelight. She glances at the capsules, then returns to her book as Stella and Jeff are heard. She descends the stairs as Lisa approaches them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Stella blurts out as Lisa turns from the window, interrupting her. Jeff, still staring out, looks surprised and points. Lisa moves toward the shelf as Jeff turns back, holding out his hand for the box and viewer. Lisa places them in his hand. Jeff opens the box of color slides, holding them to the light as Lisa watches curiously and Stella approaches. He squints through the viewer, then hands it to Lisa, who sees the same window view. A breeze stirs the foliage. Jeff looks at puzzled Lisa, and all three are in awe as Lisa speaks. Stella chuckles but sobers, answering their unasked question. Jeff speaks as Lisa appears at Thorwald's ground floor door, hiding tensely. Thorwald, frustrated, comes onto the fire escape above Lisa, who retreats. Both sigh in relief, and Jeff hands her something. Stella, noticing something, reaches for the long-focus lens, opens a bottle, and places four red capsules on Miss Lonely Hearts' table. Miss Lonely Hearts, in street clothes, reads a book by candlelight, glancing at the capsules. Stella and Jeff are heard as Lisa approaches them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Finally, Stella blurts out just as Lisa turns away from the window, and Stella also pivots, interrupting her in the process. Meanwhile, Jeff, who remains fixated on the view outside, suddenly has a look of discovery on his face. He quickly calls out, turning halfway around and pointing with urgency. We observe Lisa moving behind him toward the shelf as he continues speaking, then he turns his attention back to the window, extending his right hand to the side, expectantly waiting for the box and viewer. The camera pulls back slightly as Lisa approaches and places the box and viewer into his waiting hand. Jeff proceeds to open the box, which contains a collection of color slides, and he holds one or two of these slides up to the light, while Lisa looks down at him with a curious expression, and Stella steps forward from the background. He squints through the viewer, then momentarily looks away without it before returning his gaze through the viewer once more. Jeff removes the viewer from his eye and hands it over to Lisa, who raises it to her own eye. Through the viewer, we see the identical view out of the window, and then the viewer moves away, leaving us with the same scene, though not quite as still, as a gentle breeze stirs the foliage. Jeff looks up to see a puzzled expression on Lisa's face, and all three of them ease back in awe as Lisa, still gazing out, says something. Suddenly, Stella begins to chuckle, but her expression quickly sobers as she answers their unasked question while Jeff looks at Stella. Midway through Lisa's speech, Jeff starts speaking, and Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's, hiding and pressing back against the wall with tension. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns, visibly frustrated, and steps out onto the fire escape directly above Lisa, who is acutely aware of his presence and immediately retreats into the doorway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his fire escape. Both of them let out a sigh of relief, and Jeff hands something to her as Stella's brow furrows slightly, noticing something, and she reaches for the long-focus lens. She lifts it to her eye and opens a small brown bottle, taking out four red capsules, which she places on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, where a candle burns in a holder, and other lamps also illuminate the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is dressed in sedate street clothes and appears quite at peace as she sits at the table, and by the light of the candle, she proceeds to open a black-covered book and read it. The print is fine, and she bends over it for a moment, looks up at the capsules, and then returns to the book while Stella and Jeff's voices are heard in the background. She descends the stairs as Lisa comes up to join the two of them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Finally, at long last, Stella, unable to hold back any longer, blurts out just at the precise moment that Lisa turns away from the window. As this happens, Stella also pivots simultaneously, effectively interrupting Lisa in the process. Meanwhile, Jeff, still seated and remaining completely fixated on the view outside the window, suddenly experiences a look of discovery manifesting on his face. With urgency, he quickly calls out, turning halfway around in his chair and pointing with a sense of urgency. We observe Lisa as she purposefully moves behind him toward the shelf while he continues speaking intently, then he shifts his focus once again back to the window, extending his right hand to the side, expectantly waiting for the box and viewer to be handed to him. The camera subtly pulls back slightly as Lisa approaches his side, placing the box and viewer into his eagerly waiting hand. Jeff then proceeds to open the box, which contains a meticulously organized collection of color slides, and he carefully holds one or two of these slides up to the incoming light. Lisa looks down at him with a curious expression on her face, while Stella steps forward from the background to join them. Jeff squints attentively through the viewer, then momentarily looks away from it before promptly returning his gaze through the viewer once more. He eventually removes the viewer from his eye and hands it over to Lisa, who then raises it to her own eye, ready to see what he saw. Through the viewer, we see the identical captivating view out of the window, and then the viewer gently moves away, leaving us with the same picturesque scene, though it is not quite as still, as a gentle breeze softly stirs the foliage outside. Jeff looks up to see a puzzled expression on Lisa's face, and all three of them ease back in awe as Lisa continues to gaze out, saying something in response. Suddenly, Stella begins to chuckle softly, but her expression quickly sobers as she provides an answer to their collective unasked question while Jeff shifts his gaze to Stella. Midway through Lisa's speech, Jeff starts speaking, and Lisa, without warning, suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's apartment. She is hiding and pressing back against the wall, filled with tension. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns, visibly frustrated, and steps out onto the fire escape directly above where Lisa is standing, acutely aware of his looming presence. She immediately retreats into the doorway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his fire escape with a vigilant gaze. Both of them, in a moment of shared relief, let out a sigh, and Jeff hands something to her as Stella's brow furrows slightly, noticing something peculiar. She reaches for the long-focus lens and lifts it to her eye with determination, simultaneously opening a small brown bottle. Taking out four red capsules, she carefully places them on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, where a single candle burns gently in a holder, and other lamps warmly illuminate the quaint apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts herself is dressed in sedate street clothes and appears to be quite at peace as she sits alone at the table. By the flickering light of the candle, she proceeds to open a book with a black cover and begins to read its contents. The print is fine and intricate, and she bends over it for a moment, then looks up briefly at the capsules before returning to the book, all while Stella and Jeff's voices are heard softly in the background. She descends the stairs gracefully as Lisa comes up to join the two of them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Finally, as Lisa turns away from the window, Stella blurts out, her voice cutting through the air, and she pivots to face Lisa, interrupting her movement. Meanwhile, Jeff remains fixated on the view outside, his expression shifting to one of sudden realization. He quickly calls out, his voice urgent, as he turns halfway around, his finger extending to point at something of interest. Lisa, moving with purpose, steps behind him toward the shelf, her actions synchronized with Jeff's words. Jeff then redirects his attention back to the window, his right hand extending to the side, palm open and expectant, waiting for the box and viewer. The camera subtly pulls back, capturing the moment as Lisa approaches and gently places the box and viewer into his waiting hand. With a sense of anticipation, Jeff opens the box, revealing a collection of color slides nestled inside. He carefully selects one or two slides, holding them up to the light, his eyes narrowing in concentration as Lisa watches him with curiosity, and Stella advances from the background, drawn into the unfolding scene. Jeff squints through the viewer, his gaze intense, then momentarily shifts his focus away, only to return his eye to the viewer once more. Satisfied, he lowers the viewer from his eye and passes it to Lisa, who eagerly raises it to her own eye. Through the viewer, the identical view out of the window is revealed, a scene of stillness subtly animated by a gentle breeze stirring the foliage. Jeff looks up, meeting Lisa's puzzled expression, and together with Stella, they all ease back, a sense of awe enveloping them as Lisa, her gaze still fixed outside, speaks softly. Suddenly, Stella begins to chuckle, her amusement bubbling up, but her demeanor quickly shifts to seriousness as she addresses the unspoken question hanging in the air, while Jeff's eyes shift to Stella, seeking understanding. As Lisa continues speaking, Jeff's attention is drawn to a new development, and Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's apartment, her body tense as she hides and presses back against the wall. Above, in the corridor, Thorwald returns, his frustration evident, and steps out onto the fire escape directly above Lisa. Aware of his presence, Lisa immediately retreats into the doorway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald inspects his fire escape. A collective sigh of relief escapes both Lisa and Jeff, the tension dissipating momentarily. Jeff hands something to Lisa, while Stella, her brow furrowing slightly, notices something amiss and reaches for the long-focus lens. She lifts it to her eye, her focus shifting as she opens a small brown bottle, extracting four red capsules, which she carefully places on the white tablecloth in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment. The room is softly illuminated by a candle burning in a holder, accompanied by other lamps casting a warm glow. Miss Lonely Hearts, dressed in modest street clothes, exudes a sense of tranquility as she sits at the table. By the candlelight, she opens a black-covered book, her eyes scanning the fine print. She leans over the book momentarily, then glances up at the capsules before returning her attention to the text, while the voices of Stella and Jeff are heard in the background. Miss Lonely Hearts descends the stairs, her movements deliberate, as Lisa approaches Jeff and Stella, joining them in their shared moment of intrigue.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Stella interrupts Lisa as she turns from the window, prompting Jeff to call out with a look of discovery, gesturing toward the window. Lisa moves to the shelf, retrieves a box and viewer, and hands them to Jeff, who examines the color slides inside. He holds a slide to the light, squints through the viewer, and then passes it to Lisa. Through the viewer, the scene outside the window is visible, slightly animated by a breeze. Jeff, Lisa, and Stella share a moment of awe as Lisa comments on the view. Stella chuckles but quickly becomes serious, answering an unspoken question. As Lisa speaks, Jeff notices her at the ground floor door below Thorwald's, hiding tensely. Thorwald, frustrated, appears on the fire escape above her, prompting Lisa to retreat into the doorway. Both Jeff and Lisa sigh in relief. Jeff hands something to Lisa as Stella, noticing something, reaches for the long-focus lens. She observes Miss Lonely Hearts in her apartment, where a candlelit scene unfolds. Miss Lonely Hearts, dressed in street clothes, reads a book at her table, glancing at red capsules on the tablecloth. Stella and Jeff's voices are heard as Miss Lonely Hearts continues reading, creating a peaceful yet tense atmosphere.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Finally, Stella blurts out as Lisa turns away from the window, and Stella also turns, interrupting her. Jeff, who is still staring out the window of their Greenwich Village apartment in New York City, has a look of sudden discovery on his face and calls quickly, turning halfway around and pointing. We see Lisa moving behind him toward the shelf, stocked with various photography equipment owing to Jeff's profession as a photojournalist, as he adds, then he turns back to the window, holding out his right hand to the side, waiting for the box and viewer. The camera pulls back a little as Lisa comes up and places the box and viewer, essential tools for examining photographic slides, in his hand. Jeff opens the box, which contains color slides from a recent trip he took when he was still on assignment, and holds one or two of the slides up to the light as Lisa looks down at him curiously and Stella comes forward from the background. He squints out through the viewer, a vintage model popular among photographers of the time, then looks away a moment without it before looking back through the viewer. Jeff takes the viewer from his eye, hands it to Lisa, who raises it to her eye. Through the viewer, we see the identical view out of the window into the courtyard of their apartment complex, then the viewer moves away, and we are left with the same scene but not quite so still, as a slight breeze stirs the foliage of the communal garden below. Jeff looks up to a puzzled Lisa, and all three ease back in awe as Lisa, still looking out, says something. Suddenly Stella begins to chuckle, but her face sobers as she answers their unasked question while Jeff looks at Stella. Halfway through Lisa's speech, Jeff begins speaking, and Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's apartment, a neighbor known for his suspicious and secretive behavior, hiding and pressing back against the wall tensely. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns frustrated and comes out onto the fire escape directly above Lisa, who is aware of him and immediately retreats into the doorway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his fire escape. There is a sigh of relief from both of them, and Jeff hands something to her as Stella's brow knits a little, seeing something, and she reaches for the long-focus lens, which Jeff often uses for capturing distant scenes in detail. She lifts it to her eye and opens a small brown bottle, taking out four red capsules which she places on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, a woman who lives alone and is known for her solitary lifestyle, where a candle burns in a holder, and other lamps also light the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is dressed in sedate street clothes and seems quite at peace as she sits at the table, and by the light of the candle, proceeds to open a black-covered book often seen as a source of solace during her lonely evenings and read it. The print is fine, and she bends over it a moment, looks up at the capsules, and returns to the book while Stella and Jeff are heard over. She comes down the stairs as Lisa comes up to the two of them.

In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. then the viewer moves away and we are left with the same scene but not quite so still as a slight breeze stirs the foliage. Jeff looks up to a puzzled Lisa and all three ease back in awe as Lisa still looking out says something. Suddenly Stella begins to chuckle but her face sobers as she answers their unasked question while Jeff looks at Stella. Halfway through Lisa's speech Jeff begins speaking and Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's hiding and pressing back against the wall tensely. In the corridor above Thorwald returns frustrated and comes out onto the fire escape directly above Lisa who is aware of him and immediately retreats into the doorway disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his fire escape. There is a sigh of relief from both of them and Jeff hands something to her as Stella's brow knits a little seeing something and she reaches for the longfocus lens. She lifts it to her eye and opens a small brown bottle taking out four red capsules which she places on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment where a candle burns in a holder and other lamps also light the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is dressed in sedate street clothes and seems quite at peace as she sits at the table and by the light of the candle proceeds to open a blackcovered book and read it. The print is fine and she bends over it a moment looks up at the capsules and returns to the book while Stella and Jeff are heard over. She comes down the stairs as Lisa comes up to the two of them.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Finally, the giraffe blurts out as the dog turns away from the window, and the giraffe also turns, interrupting the dog. The fish, who is still staring out the window, has a look of sudden discovery on its face and calls quickly, turning halfway around and pointing. We see the dog moving behind the fish toward the shelf as it adds, then it turns back to the window, holding out its right hand to the side, waiting for the box and viewer. The camera pulls back a little as the dog comes up and places the box and viewer in its hand. The fish opens the box, which contains color slides, and holds one or two of the slides up to the light as the dog looks down at it curiously and the giraffe comes forward from the background. The fish squints out through the viewer, then looks away a moment without it before looking back through the viewer. The fish takes the viewer from its eye, hands it to the dog, who raises it to its eye. Through the viewer, we see the identical view out of the window, then the viewer moves away, and we are left with the same scene but not quite so still, as a slight breeze stirs the foliage. The fish looks up to a puzzled dog, and all three ease back in awe as the dog, still looking out, says something. Suddenly, the giraffe begins to chuckle, but its face sobers as it answers their unasked question while the fish looks at the giraffe. Halfway through the dog's speech, the fish begins speaking, and the dog suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's, hiding and pressing back against the wall tensely. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns frustrated and comes out onto the fire escape directly above the dog, who is aware of him and immediately retreats into the doorway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his fire escape. There is a sigh of relief from both of them, and the fish hands something to the dog as the giraffe's brow knits a little, seeing something, and it reaches for the long-focus lens. It lifts it to its eye and opens a small brown bottle, taking out four red capsules which it places on the white tablecloth of its little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, where a candle burns in a holder, and other lamps also light the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is dressed in sedate street clothes and seems quite at peace as she sits at the table, and by the light of the candle, proceeds to open a black-covered book and read it. The print is fine, and she bends over it a moment, looks up at the capsules, and returns to the book while the giraffe and the fish are heard over. She comes down the stairs as the dog comes up to the two of them.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Finally, Stella blurts out as Lisa turns away from the river, and Stella also turns, interrupting her. In the staircase above, Thorwald returns frustrated and comes out onto the balcony directly above Lisa, who is aware of him and immediately retreats into the archway, disappearing down the lower corridor as Thorwald searches his balcony. She lifts it to her eye and opens a small silver box, taking out four blue marbles which she places on the green picnic cloth of her little balcony in Miss Lonely Hearts' villa, where a lantern burns in a holder, and other torches also light the villa. Miss Lonely Hearts is dressed in bright garden attire and seems quite at peace as she sits at the balcony, and by the light of the lantern, proceeds to open a gold-covered journal and read it. test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Finally, Stella sings out as Lisa turns away from the window, and Stella also dances, distracting her. Jeff, who is still painting out the window, has a look of sudden amusement on his face and laughs quickly, spinning halfway around and gesturing. We see Lisa jumping behind him toward the shelf as he whispers, then he spins back to the window, waving his right hand to the side, reaching for the box and viewer. The camera zooms in a little as Lisa skips up and tosses the box and viewer into his hand. Jeff shakes the box, which contains color slides, and holds one or two of the slides up to the light as Lisa gazes down at him curiously and Stella glides forward from the background. He winks out through the viewer, then glances away a moment without it before peeking back through the viewer. Jeff removes the viewer from his eye, hands it to Lisa, who lifts it to her eye. Through the viewer, we see the identical view out of the window, then the viewer drops away, and we are left with the same scene but not quite so still, as a slight breeze tickles the foliage. Jeff gazes up to a puzzled Lisa, and all three drift back in awe as Lisa, still gazing out, hums something. Suddenly Stella begins to whistle, but her face tightens as she whispers their unasked question while Jeff gazes at Stella. Halfway through Lisa's song, Jeff begins singing, and Lisa suddenly appears at the ground floor door below Thorwald's, crouching and leaning back against the wall tensely. In the corridor above, Thorwald returns dejected and steps out onto the fire escape directly above Lisa, who is aware of him and promptly melts into the doorway, vanishing down the lower corridor as Thorwald examines his fire escape. There is a nod of relief from both of them, and Jeff offers something to her as Stella's brow furrows a little, noticing something, and she reaches for the long-focus lens. She raises it to her eye and shakes a small brown bottle, taking out four red capsules which she places on the white tablecloth of her little table in Miss Lonely Hearts' apartment, where a candle flickers in a holder, and other lamps also light the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is dressed in vibrant street clothes and seems quite at ease as she reclines at the table, and by the flicker of the candle, proceeds to open a black-covered book and sketch in it. The print is tiny, and she leans over it a moment, glances up at the capsules, and returns to the book while Stella and Jeff are heard over. She dances down the stairs as Lisa waltzes up to the two of them.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Finally, Oliver mumbles out as Sarah shuffles away from the lamp, and Oliver also pivots, disturbing her. Nolan, who is still gazing out the lamp, has an expression of sudden bewilderment on his face and sings quickly, spinning halfway around and waving. We see Sarah dancing behind him toward the table as he subtracts, then he spins back to the lamp, holding out his left hand to the side, waiting for the book and telescope. The camera pushes forward a little as Sarah strolls up and places the book and telescope in his hand. Nolan closes the book, which contains black drawings, and waves one or two of the drawings up to the light as Sarah gazes at him curiously and Oliver bounces forward from the background. He peers out through the telescope, then glances away a moment without it before peeking back through the telescope. Nolan drops the telescope from his eye, hands it to Sarah, who elevates it to her eye. Through the telescope, we see the identical scene out of the lamp, then the telescope drifts away, and we are left with the same scene but not quite so serene, as a slight breeze wobbles the flag. Nolan stares up to a bewildered Sarah, and all three slump back in wonder as Sarah, still gazing out, mumbles something. Suddenly Oliver begins to snicker, but his face tenses as he solves their unasked riddle while Nolan glances at Oliver. Halfway through Sarah's monologue, Nolan begins whispering, and Sarah suddenly appears at the upper floor window above Anderson's, crouching and leaning back against the railing nervously. In the alleyway below, Anderson returns annoyed and leaps out onto the balcony directly below Sarah, who is cautious of him and immediately darts into the railing, vanishing down the upper alleyway as Anderson inspects his balcony. There is a gasp of relief from both of them, and Nolan hands something to her as Oliver's brow lifts a little, hearing something, and he reaches for the short-focus camera. He lifts it to his eye and shuts a small green notebook, taking out four blue marbles which he places on the black couch of her large room in Mr. Blue's apartment, where a lantern flickers in a fixture, and other lights also illuminate the apartment. Mr. Blue is clad in bright party clothes and seems quite at ease as he rests at the couch, and by the flicker of the lantern, proceeds to shut a red-covered novel and sketch it. The drawings are bold, and he straightens over it a moment, gazes up at the marbles, and returns to the sketch while Oliver and Nolan are heard over. He glides down the ladder as Sarah glides up to the two of them.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Finally, Stella exclaims as Lisa turns away from the tapestry, and Stella also spins, distracting her. Jeff, who is still gazing out the tapestry, has a look of sudden invention on his face and whispers quickly, rotating halfway around and gesturing. We see Lisa gliding behind him toward the cupboard as he suggests, then he rotates back to the tapestry, extending his left hand to the side, awaiting the jar and mirror. The camera zooms in a tad as Lisa steps up and places the jar and mirror in his hand. Jeff unlocks the jar, which contains colorful marbles, and elevates one or two of the marbles to the lamp as Lisa gazes down at him inquisitively and Stella advances from the background. He peers through the mirror, then glances away a moment without it before peering back through the mirror. Jeff removes the mirror from his face, hands it to Lisa, who lifts it to her face. Through the mirror, we see the identical tapestry view, then the mirror shifts away, and we are left with the same scene but not quite so calm, as a gentle breeze stirs the drapes. Jeff glances up to a perplexed Lisa, and all three recline back in wonder as Lisa, still peering out, remarks something. Suddenly Stella begins to giggle, but her face turns serious as she responds to their unspoken inquiry while Jeff stares at Stella. Halfway through Lisa’s dialogue, Jeff starts murmuring, and Lisa suddenly emerges at the basement entrance beside Thorwald's, crouching and leaning back against the fence tensely. In the hallway above, Thorwald returns exasperated and steps onto the balcony directly above Lisa, who notices him and promptly withdraws into the entrance, vanishing down the lower hallway as Thorwald inspects his balcony. There is a breath of relief from both of them, and Jeff passes something to her as Stella’s brow furrows a little, observing something, and she reaches for the binoculars. She raises it to her eye and opens a small blue jar, taking out four green bubbles which she places on the black carpet of her small alcove in Miss Lonely Hearts’ apartment, where an incense stick smolders in a holder, and other candles also illuminate the apartment. Miss Lonely Hearts is clad in vibrant party attire and appears quite joyful as she reclines in the alcove, and by the glow of the incense, proceeds to open a white-covered notebook and inspect it. The text is intricate, and she leans over it a moment, glances up at the bubbles, and returns to the notebook while Stella and Jeff are overheard. She descends the ladder as Lisa ascends to the pair of them.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: At last, the parrot blurts out as Harvey pivots away from the curtain, and the parrot also swivels, disrupting it. Marge, who is still gazing into the mirror, has an expression of sudden curiosity on her face and whistles abruptly, twirling halfway around and gesturing. We spot Harvey walking behind her toward the piano as Marge adds, then she swivels back to the mirror, extending her left hand to the ceiling, hoping for the candle and telescope. The camera zooms out slightly as Harvey comes forward and places the candle and telescope in her hand. Marge opens the candle, which holds tiny maps, and lifts one or two of the maps up to the breeze as Harvey glances down at her perplexedly and the parrot hops forward from the shadows. She blinks through the telescope, then dismisses it briefly without it before peering back through the telescope. Marge removes the telescope from her gaze, passes it to Harvey, who lifts it to his gaze. Through the telescope, we glimpse the mirrored scene out of the curtain, then the telescope shifts away, and we are left with the mirrored reflection but not quite so silent, as a gentle wind stirs the curtains. Marge glances up to a confused Harvey, and all three retreat in wonder as Harvey, still peering out, remarks something. Abruptly, the parrot starts to snicker, but its beak straightens as it answers their unvoiced query while Marge observes the parrot. Midway through Harvey's monologue, Marge begins chiming in, and Harvey suddenly appears at the first-floor hatch beneath Baker’s, crouching and leaning against the trunk anxiously. In the lane overhead, Baker arrives flustered and exits onto the ladder landing directly over Harvey, who senses her and quickly withdraws into the hatch, vanishing down the upper alley as Baker examines her ladder. There's a breath of ease from both, and Marge hands something to him as the parrot's eyes narrow slightly, seeing something, and it reaches for the short-scope binoculars. It raises them to its beak and opens a small green canister, extracting four blue candies which it arranges on the red blanket of its tiny desk in Mr. Lonely Tunes' studio, where a lantern glows in a sconce, and other torches also illuminate the studio. Mr. Lonely Tunes is dressed in lively night attire and appears wholly serene as he reclines at the desk, and by the glow of the lantern, continues to skim a white-bound diary and study it. The script is tiny, and he leans over it briefly, glances at the candies, and goes back to the diary while the parrot and Marge are heard offstage. He ascends the ladder as Harvey arrives at the two of them.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Stella abruptly interrupts Lisa, who is turning away from the window, while Jeff, who notices something outside, gestures for the viewer. Lisa brings it to him, and he examines color slides. Curious, Lisa peers through the viewer, seeing the same outdoor scene, now with a slight breeze stirring the foliage. The three friends share a moment of awe, with Lisa commenting on the view. Stella chuckles but then turns serious, answering an unspoken question. As Lisa sneaks to Thorwald's ground floor door, Jeff and Stella exchange items, with Stella noticing something through a long-focus lens. She watches Miss Lonely Hearts in her apartment, who, peacefully dressed, sits at a table lit by a candle. Miss Lonely Hearts reads a fine-print book, glancing occasionally at red capsules on the table.
